content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Score A has one staff in the treble clef. It has two measures. There are no key signatures and the time signature is two four time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score A is: quarter, eighth, eighth. The pitches are: G4, F sharp 4, and C5. The rhythm in measure 2 of score A is: eighth, eighth, and quarter. The pitches are B4, G4, and A4.

Score B has one staff in the treble clef. It has two measures. There are no key signatures and the time signature is two four time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score B is: quarter, eighth, and eighth with a tie to the next measure. The pitches are: G4, F sharp 4, C5. The rhythm in measure 2 of score B is: eighth tied from last measure, sixteenth, sixteenth, and quarter. The pitches are C5 tied, B4, G4, and A4.

Score C has one staff in the treble clef. It has two measures. There are no key signatures and the time signature is two four time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score C is: quarter, eighth, and eighth with a tie to the next measure. The pitches are: G4, F sharp 4, and C5. The rhythm in measure 2 of score C is: sixteenth tied from last measure, sixteenth, eighth, and quarter. The pitches are C5, B4, G4, and A4.

Score D has one staff in the treble clef. It has two measures. There are no key signatures and the time signature is two four time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score D is: quarter, eighth, and eighth. The pitches are: G4, F sharp 4, and C5. The rhythm in measure 2 of score D is: dotted eighth, sixteenth, and quarter. The pitches are B4, G4, and A4.

content.answer: Score B has one staff in the treble clef. It has two measures. There are no key signatures and the time signature is two four time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score B is: quarter, eighth, and eighth with a tie to the next measure. The pitches are: G4, F sharp 4, C5. The rhythm in measure 2 of score B is: eighth tied from last measure, sixteenth, sixteenth, and quarter. The pitches are C5 tied, B4, G4, and A4.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
